Comment:
Hi everyone!

Here is another game involving 2 bishops v 1 rook.  I had the rook and you've guessed it, I lost.  Here is how the action unfolded.  Jim kicks off with 1. e4.
3. d4 - this is the Scotch Game.  Next move will transpose into a kind of Goring Gambit which I accept.

14. f4 - I must consent to my castled position being broken up or lose a piece.  In fact I do not actually lose a piece.  As I am 2 pawns up I get 3 pawns for the piece.  The first material imbalance but here it will favour white.

30. ....... a6 - giving Henry some luft but Jim's next move puts me in white flag territory.  Bd3 threatens a deadly discovery resulting in the loss of the rook on b1.  I therefore resigned the game on the grounds of ruinous loss of material.  Well played Jim, Part 4 coming up.
